website_summaries.verdict: With one of the longest leash tapes on the market, Flexi has a heavy-duty design meant for larger dogs.
pros: Impressively long 26-foot leash tape built for dogs up to 110 pounds
Open handle construction for easy cleaning and detangling
cons: Handle is heavy, since it's meant for large dogs

customer_reviews.title: Item l received as MOLDY and SCRATCHED
customer_reviews.text: I submitted a well-worded review yesterday stateing that the item I received was MOLDY, SCRATCHED, and most likely used. My review was rejected...I can only suppose Amazon did no believe me. Thankfully I had not yet returned the item, so I risked asthma, opened it up and took photos ...I wish I could photograph the smell! Considering the beautiful items shown on "Flexi's" listings, as well as the rave reviews, I think Amazon should spend their energy trying to figure out how this could have happened, rather than rejecting an accurate review.
customer_reviews.author: Deb P

customer_reviews.title: Used and Broken
customer_reviews.text: My 26 foot Flexi dog leash arrived in 2 days. It is NOT in new condition, if fact it is broken and unusable. The leash tape is broke (not sure how you would ever break something like that) The recoil spring does not work the tape and handle still have dirt, actual dirt on them and the handle is scratched and gouged. There is no way anyone could mistake this for a NEW or even usable product. See pictures. 1 star
customer_reviews.author: Liles J

customer_reviews.title: Good leash design
customer_reviews.text: My 90lb dog is a mild puller and this leash is holding up fine. Build quality for price seems a good value. The florescent green material is bright and is easily seen in the dark. I also like how the roll of material hangs more down then out front, it's easier on my wrist Update 11/25/16 : After a year of chasing squirrels and deer my now 105lb dog has failed to break this leash. It's still going strong !!!
customer_reviews.author: N. Lorenzoni

customer_reviews.title: but I like the yellow safety tape color for extra protection on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is what I have been looking for! Looks to be a little bit inferior to the same model I bought more than 10 years ago. The ribbon was a little bit thicker on my original leash, but I like the yellow safety tape color for extra protection on night walks. Much better that the Flexi Explore leash I bought a couple of months ago and gave a bad review to, because it snapped after just 1 month of use. This version is almost 3 times the price but well worth it. Leashes are like life lines that should never break. Spend the extra money on safety and quality. Watch my demonstration video.
customer_reviews.author: RC Beach Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Used to be excellent
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this brand for 20 years and this is the first time the product has not been excellent. We bought two of these to replace some that were worn out after years of good service. We were shocked when both of them broke after less than 6 months of moderate use. Seems to be a design flaw with this model since the tape broke in the same place on both of them. Not sure what we will use now, but it certainly won't be this!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H. Glew

customer_reviews.title: Leash already failing after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: The last one I had lasted seven months. The tape on this one is failing already. I received it July 13, and today is August 19. I am beyond the return window. VERY DISSATISFIED! ADD: I put a drop of glue on the spot where the tape is unraveling, and secured it with strong thread. Not a desirable solution, but the patch is holding. The manufacturer needs to solve this problem with the weak tape that they use because otherwise this is a useful item.
customer_reviews.author: JacksGirl

customer_reviews.title: Worse quality than dollar store leashes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this February and it’s already broken several months later. At first it was difficult to deal with because the cord would get stuck ALL THE TIME, now it doesn’t lock so now I’ve got an annoyingly long leash that won’t lock when I need to keep my dog from something or someone. I definitely should have followed through with my return...
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: Two Weeks and Completely Broken
customer_reviews.text: Total junk- broke internally after two weeks being used twice daily to walk a deaf 35 pound juvenile dog. I had the same Flexi-Giant purchased twenty years ago for a large dog. It didn’t break- the fabric strap finally wore out (which is why I bought a new one)....In disgust over the new leash breaking I purchased military grade strapping and my husband rebuilt the twenty plus year old Flexi Giant (see photo #3) I’m lucky I simply hadn’t tossed it out when the new one arrived. I can’t in good conscience advise anyone to buy this product. It’s total garbage and nowhere near the quality of their old leads.
customer_reviews.author: Nonesuch

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as BUTTER!
customer_reviews.text: I've had FLEXI leashes for decades and never had a problem with them, but WOW this one is MUCH nicer than the old classics. It is so smooth, so quiet and ergonomic unlike the clunkier original version. The yellow tape is really nice too, since the black is difficult to see when crossing a street. I would really recommend this even though it's expensive. I have big dogs (Pitbulls 75 and 85 lbs) but like the Medium size because they are lighter and better for a woman's hands IMHO. I haven't ever had a Medium (old style) malfunction even holding them back from lunges, dog fights, etc. so feel confident in the FLEXI technology.
customer_reviews.author: David Booth

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one month
customer_reviews.text: The leash went off the track and my husband tried to fix it but now it wont retract. Very disappointed in the product. Purchased it March 4 and April 8 is already broken
customer_reviews.author: tkcarson

customer_reviews.title: Tough but Tiresome
customer_reviews.text: This is one heavy leash.. I know it is supposed to be for big strong dogs, but it is very heavy on the hand when you are walking and it is hard to reel the pet back in. It is good to be slow to reel out but not to reel them back in. It is designed with a downward slope to it and it gets heavy on the hand. Your wrist gets tired during the walk and you find yourself switching hands off and on through the whole walk. It seems sturdy enough to last a long time but it just will get tiresome to use after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M. Wrobel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful flat lead flexi. I have 28# Whippet. Perfect size/length for her. Always use caution to avoid tangling. Never use in crowds. New ones need time to rewind sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Char W

customer_reviews.title: Not durable, not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe I spent over $30 on a leash that didn’t last a day and a half. Me and my 45lb husky are avid hikers. He’s a puller, and the leash snapped. It was a clean break right near the end where it fastens to his collar. Lasted less than 8 hours total. Yes the leash is ergonomic and “easy to lock” but it is NOT durable in the slightest bit. If you have a big dog or a dog who likes to pull - find another leash.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well-constructed and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: No question this product is pricey for a dog leash, but I'm so glad I bought it. Works great for my 86-pound Golden and I'm sure would handle bigger dogs well. Smooth operation, heavy duty and just feels like a product that is built to last. Usually I stick to four stars because when shopping I usually think the five-star reviews are too good to be true and must have been done by a paid reviewer (suspicious by nature I guess). But I am about as enthusiastic about this item as you can get about something like a leash. My dog would much prefer no leash, but the long length on this one is the next best thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger243

customer_reviews.title: Great retractible leash but be aware of the tension
customer_reviews.text: I had originally ordered the Large version of the Flexi Giant Tape Leash for my 55 lb Am Staff cross. The Large said it was for 50+ lbs. However, when I got it and tried it out the tension was to tight. My boy is fairly passive and doesn't pull much. He wouldn't pull against the leash hard enough to extend it. I returned it with no problems and reordered the medium (for up to 50 lbs). The medium is perfect! It has a smooth operation, the tension is not as tight, and I love that he can have some freedom on walks while still being on leash. The handle is comfortable and not to heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great leash
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a couple years now. It's a great leash. Love the long length and the sturdiness of the product. My dog is around 50 lbs and this leash has no trouble locking and holding him back. This is one of the better leashes I have used. MY only complaint, and it's a minor one, is that in the summer the handle of the leash can get a little slippery, but other than that this thing is solid. 5/5 Would purchase again. In fact, this is probably the only leash I will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: stoleurmoney

customer_reviews.title: Wow - better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to order this due to the price. I only want to buy one - ever! So I figured I needed the best of the best. My dog is a 125lb GSD and all the cheaper priced retractables seem to only be rated for up to 110lbs. My boy isn't too bad of a puller, he just likes to have his nose on the ground and check everything out. Arrived quickly and we tried it out right away. Fits in my hand comfortably (small hands, was worried it would be too big and hard to hold). Clips to my dog's vest nicely. He hears the lock and knows that he can't keep going. Overall great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: New design is better
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using Flexi for years and were always pleased with the performance of the leashes. We take our walks on a beach so the only issue we had with it was if/when we accidentally drop the leash it gets filled with sand and sometimes prevents the lock from functioning properly. This new design, however, with an open concept for the tape has taken care of that problem. The leash once again slipped out of my hand this morning but with our new purchase I didn’t have to deal with trying to tap the sand out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas T Sproat

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Those Germans know how to engineer things! I've had a flexi before and the thing is 9 years old and still works fine. The XL giant is the Ferrari of Flexi. I like the tape instead of the cord and it's just smooth. Top shelf gear, you won't be disappointed. It's also almost half the price of getting scammed by buying it in Canada. They pet store down the road wants $89 bucks for and XL Giant Flexi..........
customer_reviews.author: Jordy

customer_reviews.title: My dog Loves this leash!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 45lb dog and I got the L leash. Its amazing and I love it! My dog isn't normally a puller when we are walking but she sometimes takes off after rabbits. When this happens I can stop her quickly and securely and the leash does amazing! I love how sturdy it feels, and how thick the leash part is. Its a real leash, not some thin cord like most retractable leashes. The Neon yellow leash is a bit obnoxious and took some getting used to but I understand it is for safety and I can appreciate that. Overall a great leash and I would 100% recommend
customer_reviews.author: PerfectlyTolerable

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It’s large but not awkwardly heavy. Feels solids and heavy duty enough to easily handle my boisterous 75lb boxer. Retracts/extends very smoothly. Doesn’t get tangled when retracting. Only criticism of the design, and its only a slight one: The lock tab is a little small compared to the button you press to make the leash stop extending. The button depresses easily even with gloves so it hasn’t been a problem. It’s just a little difficult to lock the button down with the tab when I have gloves on. I would absolutely buy again and have already recommended it to others.
customer_reviews.author: M Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Leash For Big Dog
customer_reviews.text: Got this leash for our new 85 pound mixed Labrador. The best part of this leash is its ergonomic handle which has the leash exit point at 45 degree angle from the handle which makes very easy to retrieve the actual tape leash. I also have Flexi-3 leash I bought over 15 years ago and it still works. The biggest difference between the leashes is the Flexi-3 leash you have to tilt up handle to retrieve the leash. There about the same size and weight. Highly recommend this leash.
customer_reviews.author: CRC

customer_reviews.title: Line breaks way to easy.
customer_reviews.text: My 60 lb Belgian Malinois has snapped 2 of these now... The lbs rating is way to high. My dog is never allowed to chew on the line and is never left alone with it on.
customer_reviews.author: adam chase

customer_reviews.title: Best leash
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these from our dog trainer who swears by it. After that I’ve purchased another one to keep in my car. We walk twice a day and also go on long hikes weekly (magzilla.blog). It took a bit of time to get use to but using it for a week or so made me a leash expert ;). Love the length and the durability. Even if the leash gets twisted, it self-adjusts while going back in the leash-housing and gets straightened out. I also love the bright color. Handle is big enough and comfortable to hold. I even keep a poopy-bag on it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Icicle4

customer_reviews.title: I need to find a better leash!
customer_reviews.text: My pyredoodle puppy was only 50lbs, but he could grow to twice that size, so I did my research for the strongest retractable leash. This leash looked to be the most promising. Just 33 days after it arrived, the tape started separating from the plastic that attaches it to the clasp (the piece that clips to the dog collar). It's not worth risking my dog with a poorly made leash...I need to find a better leash!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Great retractable leash
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The best retractable leash I ever used (I owned a few). A much better product compared to Flexi3-8 long. It’s a heavy duty flat tape as opposed to a cord on Flexi leashes. Also, it retracts all the way as opposed to Flexi that leaves a foot of lead that dangles uselessly. I do recommend a bungee extender (1/2 foot) that reduces a pull shock in case your dog pulls a lot. Mine doesn’t but I got one just in case. All in all, great product, albeit a little on a heavy side when you get a large unit.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Secure and Strong
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My dog is 18 lbs and she seems so secure on this retractable leash, I like how smooth it retracts and easily she can pull it to walk or run. Effortlessly I lock, unlock and sometimes just use the temporary stop button. I like the long ribbon for times we are at the park, she really has fun running around and I have fun watching her run around. The leash seems very solid and well built and has a nice weight to it. I'm very happy along with my Lady(ruff-ruff)that I purchased this item.
customer_reviews.author: Christine G😊MTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Love this leash for an older dog
customer_reviews.text: Our little dog is 13 and losing her hearing. The little she has left she uses selectively and conveniently doesn't do what she's supposed to like coming back inside! We were going to get stake to put in the yard but decided we needed to reel her in like a catfish. This leash did the trick! It is very well made. It doesn't matter how many times she twists it, it reels in smoothly every time! We have a lever type doorknob and so we hook the leash over it and she can wander to her heart's content and we can watch out the window her from the nice warm house.
customer_reviews.author: Rhinestone Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: My 65lb tracker/hunter has really put the strength of this to the test and so far it’s passing. He has forcefully yanked on it (and yanked it out of my hands) many times and it still works. It doesn’t ravel in and out quite as smoothly as the first couple times using it but it still definitely works. I like the handle —i have small hands and have no problem getting a firm grip as well as accessing the locking mechanism. I’ve been using it for about a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Traima

customer_reviews.title: I’m 5’2 And petite, and have a Hyper big husky I can now control easily
customer_reviews.text: I have a one-year-old rescue Siberian husky and she has a lot of energy and is very hyper and strong. I am 52 and 130 pounds and I have a pretty muscular build but sometime she pulls and pulls me LOL since I got this it has been much better than any pet store experience I’ve had with the other brands at Petsmart etc. I’ve had to return and I’ve kept this one and even my fiancé loves it and I love how there is a reflective cable because we live out in the wilderness. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had before
customer_reviews.text: I needed a long leash so my dog can "browse" and roam the neighborhood trees and streets yet still be under control. I like the tape as I feel its safer than the cord - I am not keen on the color because it is a pale yellow and I can't tell how reflective it really is - I can hardly see it myself when it gets dark out and/or snows! It should be more neon, in my opinion. When it goes to the end, it gets stuck often, and I have to manually put it back in a little bit so it will retract. The quality seems to be less than the previous one I owned from Flexi.
customer_reviews.author: Magicwish33

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but difficult to find a retailer.
customer_reviews.text: 3/1/2019. Replace my old Flexi tape leash due to my Golden Retriever weight is about 100 lbs and she can tug strongly when excited. This unit has a 50% larger leash webbing fabric and will tolerate a heavier strain (claim is 220 lb dog). Easy to use and I am more confident it won't break. Th biggest issue was finding a retailer who sells the unit. I am satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Thule1

customer_reviews.title: Our second one
customer_reviews.text: We bought our first Flexi leash, the then- equivalent of this leash, about 8 years ago! It is still going, despite many drops and drags on concrete/asphalt (we have an Aussie, and he thinks he is a sled dog sometimes). We only bought this one because Parker was going to stay with our daughter and her son for a month, and were afraid it might break during that time. Honestly, I am amazed it has lasted this long, used 5-8 x per day for all those years. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: JC808

customer_reviews.title: Quality workmanship
customer_reviews.text: This type of leash was recommended to us during our dogs recovery from knee surgery. This particular one was a great choice. The leash appears to be made well and feels like quality workmanship. The handle is a comfortable design and it’s easy to use. We are able to give her more freedom as she continues to recover while at the same time, remain in control of her and prevent her from chasing a bunny or squirrel. I highly recommend this quality retractable leash. We purchased a (giant) medium for our 50# Goldendoodle and it’s just right for her.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperLady

customer_reviews.title: Large and Awkward
customer_reviews.text: I think a lot of women would find this very awkward in their hands. It wasn't comfortable in my hand and seemed to lag a bit in reeling the tape back in. This went back to Amazon after my dog was on it for only a minute, and I realized it wouldn't suit my needs. I also was concerned that the lag in reeling the tape back in might result in the tape becoming quite dirty and possibly reel in sand, dirt, etc., that might build up inside.
customer_reviews.author: AnnTop Contributor: Watercolor Painting

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my MWD
customer_reviews.text: Been using this brand retractable for my Military working dogs and personal dogs for years. Holds up great and can really take a beating. Bought this new after wanting to replace my old one after 3 years and one deployment. Was able to hold back my 105 Lb dog and it feeds nicely. This style is way better than the closed feeded ones as this one doesn’t get tangled on the inside. Only dislike is the highlighter green color, makes you stand out too much
customer_reviews.author: In Robbie We Trust

customer_reviews.title: Great lead for going for a walk
customer_reviews.text: This retractable lead is great for going for walks. I paired it w/ a Ruffwear harness and it is a perfect match and comfortable for my four legged family member (border collie mix). Gives her some freedom yet I maintain control if required. She can explore within a 26' radius. So far has stood up well to walks 3 times a day. the lock to stop the tape paying out or retracting is not really a brake and will not engage if the tape is reeling out rapidly. I design with a friction brake would be nice to slow down the tape payout / in speed.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Y. Banquer

customer_reviews.title: It is durable
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. We bought it just in case the 1st one breaks. It is durable and has taken all the abuse my 2 year old dog could dish out. We bought it because our pup likes to play tug of was with his leash sometimes and has bitten part of the way through the leash. I half expected to pull apart but the strapping has held through all his pulling and biting on the leash. Our puppy only weighs about 60 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Gary K Psyche

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVE
customer_reviews.text: This is our fave leash! it's long enough and the leash is wide enough. It retracks well too! and you can see it during the day and night. So, this is our fave. We have a small dog. He is only 10 pounds. They tangle easily. and I do like to let him roam just a bit when we walk so he gets a little extra exercise. Weight is such a problem for them sometimes! this is long enough! He rarely uses all of the line. it is heavy! keep that in mind though. It's not as light as the thin line ones. BUT you won't get your legs all chewed up either if he wraps around you!
customer_reviews.author: JurisrnTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Spend a slight bit more is certainly worth it !
customer_reviews.text: This was a winner ! Instead of purchasing multiple $15-20 retractable leashes at local stores (internal mechanisms ALWAYS broke), I decided to buy this one. A neighbor purchased and loved it, so I decided to try. Happy that I purchased! It's durability, non-binding and has not failed yet.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Impressed, so far.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leash for my little doxie/aussie.. I want the extra length for our walks, but always worry she won't be able to pull it, comfortably.. This leash seems very sturdy, and well made.. The action is smooth, and my 27 pound dog can use it, easily.. I was hesitant to spend 35 bucks on a leash, but for now I'm very happy.. Time will tell if it was worth the money..
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and durable
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these (same brand) of the old design that lasted through two dogs. So far I am pleased with the new tape design verses the cord. Although it is sort of heavy and bulky, it is perfect for early morning walks when I’m not quite awake so my dog can venture off a bit, but still be basically under control. I don’t like to use it if other people/dogs are around as I don’t feel I have as much control.
customer_reviews.author: Suz-

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!!
customer_reviews.text: My beagle is not to be trusted off leash, and I don't have a fence. Therefore he must be leashed and attended any time he goes potty. I also live in a place with snow. You can imagine how unhappy I am to have to leave my warm house to take him out for his final potty. With this leash I can kick that poor hound out the door, leaving it open just enough for the leash, and stay in my nice warm house. The leash itself seems sturdy and well built, I have no fears the leash will break and my hound escape into the woods to be someone's dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Device
customer_reviews.text: This device is very well made and functions beautifully for the designed intent. I am able to control a muscular 65 pound German Shorthair Pointer with ease ... and this breed is very high energy and natural hunters (she’s a good quail hunter). For everyday walking, this 26 foot retractable leash is great and with quickly gained experience it’s possible for fully control her movements for safety and having your dog go where you want it to go. Here in Texas we have lots of snakes and this is the best way I know to keep her from going into potentially dangerous places along the trail. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Jones

customer_reviews.title: A bit heavy, but a great leash
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy long retractable leash. As you might expect, it is very heavy. It is not particularly ergonomic or easy to hold. However, it will give your dog a very long range on the leash. I bought two of them for my dogs when we went on vacation to the beach. It was very nice to allow them a very long range on the leash. Expect to become tired of holding it eventually. Aside from the weight, I have no complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Works good till it breaks
customer_reviews.text: Leash worked well for 2 months but started making a grinding noise when it retracts..the $60 leash has a 2 year warranty so I contacted the manufacturer. I was told that I need to pay to have it shipped to them so they could determine if the failure was due to a manufacturing issue...needless to say , I tossed the $60 leash and will begin to look for a cheaper alternative...
customer_reviews.author: vchateau

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: The is the heaviest duty retractable leash I could find. I have 2 great danes (150lb and 170lb) and one had broke a smaller leash with light ribbon. I have an older heavy duty leash that also works, but this one is heavier. The only thing not better on this leash is the locking mechanism is not as smooth as my old one. It may be because the gears are courser (fewer larger teeth) so it has fewer teeth for the locking mechanism to catch.
customer_reviews.author: TrainTrax999

customer_reviews.title: Our Squirrel Chaser Broke Several Til This
customer_reviews.text: This thing is borderline indestructible. I say borderline, because I'm sure it has its limits. Our fur buddy has tested both the strength and durability of this leash, and to our shock and delight, this leash is taking it like a champ. If you have a dog that exemplifies super human strength when it comes to squirrels, get this leash. He broke 4 other brands in a matter of days, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome leash
customer_reviews.text: This leash is great, easy to hold, and hard to tangle. I'm able to let my dog roam/sniff around, and pull her in quickly if need be. It never gets tangled and is super durable. It has been dropped a few times and my dog has attempted on numerous occasions to abruptly chase squirrels/deer in the woods and brought the leash out to it's end and was yanked back. The least did not break even when I was sure that would be it. If my dog ever does manage to destroy this thing, I will definitely be getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: Genessa L

customer_reviews.title: Best lease ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a replacement for a previous retractable leash. This lease is as durable as they come. My dog is about 65lbs and she pulls like crazy when we are riding my quad. I’ve had this leash for 2 years and it still works like new. Except for my dog chewing through the leash towards the end, this leash has amazed me how strong it is. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend to anyone that wants a purchase that will last. 5 stars in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Lasted two months
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this given the reviews, but despite what seemed to be solid construction it was by far the shortest-lived retractable leash we've ever had. Other cheap $15 ones we've had have lasted years. We got this one in early December and it snapped in early February, and I don't feel like our golden retriever was overly hard on it. The company said the warranty did not help us, so we're out of luck. Not impressed with it at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Devlin

customer_reviews.title: Not so strong.
customer_reviews.text: Bought large (up to 110 lbs claimed) for my 45 lb standard poodle on 7/2/16. He broke it today trying to chase a rollerblader. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for every dog owner
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research when looking for a good leash for my Ausssiedooddle. I really like this one because of the balanced grip, swivel clip and eye that the leash extends and retracts from. The lock stops fast and strong when needed. The reflective bright yellow leash is also seen from far away. I've noticed cars slow down, where they didn't before because they see the leash. The casing is durable yet comfortable. I do wish there was some kind of guard the first 12" of the leash as my puppy has already bitten into the leash, but it seems to be tough enough and will last a long time. Very happy overall and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  and I have a 160 lbs Great Dane!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first one that doesn't break or jam. I finally ponied up the dollars for a big one even though it costs a lot more. Well worth the money. No jams or tangles. Lock works great even with a big beast on the end of the leash. She pulls hard on the leash too when another dog is around, so she definately tests its holding power. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Brian W. King

customer_reviews.title: Best extendable leash out there.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price. High quality. Tough. Long. Easy and comfortable to use. So far durable. Will update in time. Update 6/18/2020: Still working great with a 70lb dog who chases birds suddenly. Used with a Freedom No Pull Harness (from freedomnopullharness dot com). A little bigger and heavier than most but very comfortable in the hand. Very durable. We've had no issues whatsoever. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jono

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, but beware chewers
customer_reviews.text: Great leash as noted by others, but beware if your dog tends to chew the lead; they're pretty fragile and do not hold up well to dog teeth. Would be great if there was some way for the manufacturer to toughen up the first couple feet of lead near the clip end.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Everett

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I liked the reflectivity of the tape - which is what I chose this one for - but the unit was heavier than I wanted to carry for long walks. I returned it for a non-reflective but lighter-weight unit.
customer_reviews.author: JRobert

customer_reviews.title: Great Leash!
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing a Flexi Comfort leash. The old one didn't break, but the design of the lock lends itself to be accidentally locked when trying to pull in a dog. That design has almost gotten my dog hurt one too many times so I decided to get a new one that had the original handle lock system instead. The Giant Tape Leash is not only lighter than the comfort leash (same tape length), but it's smoother as well. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Weight is nice. Ergonomics are great
customer_reviews.text: Only reason for 4 stars is more times than not. When it’s fully extended. It gets hung up on the treads sewn on the end. Making it not able to retract without playing with it. I walk the trails. So not really a big deal. But an inexperienced person walking a dog on the streets. May find it dangerous and problematic. Otherwise a nice product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 112lb rottweiler while we are at the park so she can roam a bit. My old one was probably purchased 8 years ago so this is a big step up. It is bug for sure but all of the leash has to go somewhere. It is comfortable to hold and doesn't feel too heavy. My pup doesn't pull so I can't speak for that but it works well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous leash for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: This leash is dangerous. My husband ended up hospitalized after dog pulled him over rocks with running start. He ended up with a fractured and dislocated shoulder. The dog can gain momentum quickly and when a large dog 92 lbs hits the end of the 25 for distance the momentum can greatly injure and pull the leash holder off their feet. My husband was 245 lbs yet the dog pulled so hard my husband was lifted off the ground entirely and landed on rock. Well made product but I think only should be used with small dogs this kind of leash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used daily for more than two years.
customer_reviews.text: This leash is a replacement for the same leash. I bought it twice, I liked it so much. I thought I needed to replace the original because we dropped it in the sand at the beach and it was making a grinding noise. As we continued to use the original the sound went away and the leash is working just fine. The second leash will be a backup, but we haven't needed it. I think I've had the original for at least two years, using it daily. I would definitely recommend this leash.
customer_reviews.author: Darian Carson

customer_reviews.title: The leash made to walk bears
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious dog leash for strong dogs. I went through two Kong retractable leashes before discovering this leash. I bought the "Flexi Giant Tape Leash Extra Large 26FT" . I like it more and more every time I use it to walk my dog. A overlooked feature of this leash is that the leash itself is exposed to the air when fully retracted. This is such a good idea because my old leashes would get a mildew smell after walking the dog in the rain. I recommend this leash to everyone who has a dog that pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I liked the over all but obviously not quality tested well. See picture. 3 months old and the clasp came off because it was sewn on poorly. Now it has no spring to retract as it spun out with no end. Poor quality for such $
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W.

customer_reviews.title: Still holding up to my 70 lb. Pitbull mix after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leash so that my dog had a bit of moving/running room if need be. Our dog sometimes pulls on walks, and occasionally gets zoomies that cause him to take off quickly, which has pulled the leash out of our hands before. It's no fault of the leash, since it is very sturdy and comfortable to hold. He is a very strong dog, and the leash hasn't shown any sign of weakening. Sure the leash has gotten scratched up and dirty, but it's held up to everything that's been thrown at it. I'd buy another.
customer_reviews.author: sean b.

customer_reviews.title: VERY PLEASED
customer_reviews.text: OVERALL THIS IS A GIGANTIC IMPROVEMENT OVER THE CORDED VARIETY. NO DOG HAIR BUILD UP CLOGGING THE RETRACTING MECANISM VIVID VISUAL LEADS TO VIRTUALLY NO WRAPPING AROUND TREES AND BRANCHES LONGER LEAD ALLOWS POOCH PLENTY OF ROAMING WHEN POSSIBLE. EASY "LOCKING" FOR SHORTER LEAD COMFORTABLE ON THE HANDS
customer_reviews.author: jerryflah

customer_reviews.title: This is ALMOST a FANTASTIC lead -- except the swivel hook quickly wears out.
customer_reviews.text: This is ALMOST a FANTASTIC lead -- except for the swivel hook. Most things about this lead are FANTASTIC. BUT, the swivel hook soon does not "swivel well" very long. That means that the lead gets twisted and if you are not very careful when you retract it (and completely untwist it first), the lead binds on retraction -- and will not fully retract. SO, you have to stand there and pull lead out of the housing until you find the twist and then very carefully allow the lead to fully retract into the housing. IF this had a "ball bearing" swivel (they come in all sizes) and are not very expensive, IT WOULD BE FANTASTIC.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up! Superior quality. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be more pleased. Superior quality! I have peace of mind knowing that my Walker Coonhound-who thinks she’s in the Iditarod-cannot break free from this lead (unless she pulls me flat on my face, haha). Would love a splashier color next time if this one ever wears out, but I don’t think it ever will. LOVE IT. BUY ONE! You won’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not As Durable As Expected
customer_reviews.text: This leash didn't last very long. It was ordered in mid May and used for nightly walks, it is now mid-October and the leash is broken. The weak point is the seam and plastic piece where the clip attaches to the actual leash. Functioned as expected until it broke, but at this price point, I would expect it to last longer. My dog is a 70 lb Goldendoodle. He does pull on walks when he gets excited about squirrels, but he is not a constant puller. I like that it is long and gives my dog room to explore.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works for a strong dog
customer_reviews.text: My none month old pit-lab broke his previous flexi leash which was not one with the flat leash. I ordered this as a replacement. I was initially skeptical when it arrived. Unlike my other flexo leashes this does not have a housing around the spool at all. After using it for a week I have decided I like the re-design. With the older style ones if there was a tie-up or snag inside it usually meant a new leash. So far I have had no snags but it seems like if it does twist up somehow, which it doesn't seem like a possibility, it would be fixable. My pup is STRONG but so far this is holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: T Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Leash is awesome! Very tough and well made
customer_reviews.text: Leash is awesome! Very tough and well made. Nice having a long lead for bathroom breaks so dog doesnt run into woods chasing deer and other wildlife. Very smooth operation and spring has decent recoil, but not too much. Is heavier duty than our worn out flexi freedom 26'. Would recommend to anybody needing additional lead for their pets. Also, clasp has a stout plastic leader that protects stitching from becoming frayed by normal use/wear and tear/dogs that like to chew lead when attached to collar. I like this addition coming from the older flexi freedom 26'.
customer_reviews.author: killer kenne

customer_reviews.title: I love this leash
customer_reviews.text: This is an update to a flex I've had for several years. I love this leash! Initially I thought it might be too heavy for a leash but when I walk my 100lb lab I don't feel any weight to it. It has held a good "brake" when she tries to take off running after squirrels. I highly recommend this leash if you have a big dog who is a hunter. It is the only brand I will use. Prior to Flexi she broke 3 leashes in taking off after whatever her hunting eyes saw.
customer_reviews.author: KRISTY

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product and poor customer relations
customer_reviews.text: This is an inferior leash . It claims to support a dog over 100 lbs. my dog is only 90 lbs yet all 4 flexi leashes I’ve purchased in the past have either broken at the handle or the ribbon has snapped. In each case I lost my dogs. I wrote the company and it refused to replace them particularly if you don’t hold on to a $45 receipt. Very poor product and even poorer customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Krolczyk

customer_reviews.title: Giant Tape Leash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 25 foot Giant Dog Leash for our little 5 yrs 5 pound Yorkie,I have it attached to our Golf Card so she can run and play but still be secured when needed to keep track of her when we are out and about, the buckle that connects her to her BRA if you will is just heavy duty enough to keep her safe if I need to get a hold of the line and real her in without worry....
customer_reviews.author: R. Sandel

customer_reviews.title: Poor material of leash
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased this leash a few times, their XL version. Its not for big dogs who pull on the leash, it shreds almost immediately!. The material need to be better, so that if a dog pulls on the leash (with its mouth), it does not shred.
customer_reviews.author: No Bull

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Put it to the test! On a walk my 70 lb princess bolted after a deer. The leash popped out of my grip and she ran round and round a drainage area 30 yards or so with the leash banging against signposts and rocks, til I caught the leash and subdued the dog. The leash was put through the wringer and still works perfectly! Would buy again if I ever needed too! Excellent quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best retractable I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have taken my pup out on this leash every day since this arrived, and I LOVE it. It is definitely the most sturdy, smooth, and high quality retractable I have owned, and I really like that the whole leash is nylon instead of that string type most have. The neon color is also awesome for seeing it day or night (this thing nearly glows in the dark), which is helpful since she's a black lab. She gets plenty of exercise running back and forth with this leash. I am a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Hornbuckle

customer_reviews.title: 26' Leash: Works for Me
customer_reviews.text: Well if you read the disclaimers you would never buy a 26' leash! I purchased this one as a replacement to a previous red case 26’ Flexi leash. It was not as heavy duty as this one with a thinner tape but it lasted and still was working after a hard 5 years. I’m a daily dog walker walking 1,351 miles last year. Have a Siberian Husky now that is really a hand full, but walk around a lake levee and farm fields so not much contact to get into trouble with humans. The tape is bright yellow not the regular black as most is a real plus. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rickaren

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty retractable leash
customer_reviews.text: Previously had a Flexi Comfort Grip 3 leash that lasted 12.5 years. It finally stopped retracting so ordered this one. Initially ordered the large but it was extremely big (I’ve got small hands). Ordered the medium and it’s similar in size to the Comfort Grip 3. Prefer tape versus cord retractables and also like the soft grip versus hard plastic. Also like that it’s 26 ft versus the normal 16 ft length. Note these are heavy leashes. If you want something light weight, these are not it.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: must buy!
customer_reviews.text: we used to use a normal leash and our dog pulled so much and he looked uncomfortable. so I decided to give it a go since my friend told me these flexi products are amazing for walking the dog. This product is amazing! our dog never pulls anymore! and he's so happy! I feel like I could go for 10m but 8m is good enough. This product does not snap and the leash is very easy to see at night. I would love to repurchase in the future. OUR DOG IS: Flat retriever mix, 55lbs, a puller(not anymore), 5 years old / I PURCHASED: a large 8m tape leash
customer_reviews.author: TJ & Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Works really well with my big dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have TWO Flexi Giant LARGE Tape Leash and they work REALLY WELL! I have a Pitt Bull and a Boxer and they are able to run, jump and play while on these leashes. My Boxer is big on spinning around and around she is so silly and I am able to keep her safe on her leash and she can keep being herself. When I need to lock the leashes for whatever reason they lock well and do not slip or come undone until I unlock them.
customer_reviews.author: Love It Or Chuck it Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Siberian Huskies
customer_reviews.text: We have two older Siberian Huskies and this lets them explore a bit without the problems of letting them off leash. One is pretty spirited and he has done a few hard sprints to the end of the lead with no issues so far. The brake button is easy to hold down if you just want to stop the dog temporarily and simple to engage or disengage the lock one handed if desired. I was worried that the leash would be too large, but I am happy with the size.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Glad I picked this one!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this makes walks! The length of this is perfect to let my dog walk a little ahead of me without getting out of sight or wandering too far away. This is great on walks when the sidewalks are slippery and he can walk ahead without pulling me if I slow down for an icy patch. The leash hasn’t gotten tangled at all so that’s great too! The only thing that’s hard for me is locking it with one hand. I need two and this makes it cumbersome. But the lock seems strong so I would rather have a strong hold than an easy locking mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Mom in MN

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy for my 85 pound dog
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy product. The one thing I miss from having had an old version of this leash years ago is having a friction drag effect on the thumb lever. In this one the lever either locks the extension or leaves it free, with spring-loaded fixed tension. Nevertheless, I'm happy with it and the tape is long enough that my dog stays within the limit and doesn't pull.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stromquist

customer_reviews.title: My go to leash..
customer_reviews.text: I tried a bunch of other leashes because this one was so much more expensive. Man, I seriously wasted so much time. This is a serious leash for a serious pup.. Mines a 127 lb anitolian Sheppard that loves to dart off when I least expect it. This leash has handled his lil butt beautifully.. It's expensive but you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: My second flexi
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other cheaper brands, but flexi seems the most reliable. Still have one that I have had for about 8 years... but wanted a spare. also liked the new high visibility tape. It's different and not totally enclosed...ie, you can see the tape on the reel. but works great still.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! POORLY MADE
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I bought this leash in the past 6 months only to have it break the same way both times. The grey plastic piece to prevent the leash from fully retracting rubs and tears the leash directly below it. My dog also never chewed his leash, only the occasional pull when he saw a squirrel. Luckily, my 70 lb lab puppy was simply walking when it happened each time. I would not recommend this leash to anyone as it seems to have a major design flaw and is waiting to snap at any second.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Mietz

customer_reviews.title: I prefer a Flexi
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 5 large dogs. I’ve always used a Flexi retractable leash. I find them easier to handle than a regular leash. I’ve never had any problems with them and they last long. I keep it short when we walk and when we are in our yard or in the field I let them have as much lead as they want.
customer_reviews.author: J M.

customer_reviews.title: lasted a week
customer_reviews.text: the locking system is not smooth. the leash itself was stretched and deformed with couple days. it was almost chewed through in a week, and my 55lbs dog was just holding it in his mouth. the leash is too thin and weak for a big dog . no way this is adequate for a up to 110lbs dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Pathguy

customer_reviews.title: Great heavier duty retractable leash.
customer_reviews.text: Love this heavier duty retractable dog leash. Glad I bought it. Works for my 48# and 85# labradors. Excellent quality. Because it is for larger dogs, the base is a tad heavier than the one I use for my beagle but not significantly so. I recommend this product. Would buy it again but this one looks like it’s gonna last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: deniska

customer_reviews.title: I've walked several hundred miles and it's still like new. There was nothing wrong with my other ...
customer_reviews.text: Keep your dog safe and buy only Flexi mechanical leashes. Don't put your dog's life in danger by getting a bargain China leash. I've walked several hundred miles and it's still like new. There was nothing wrong with my other Flexi, this one is just larger. They will out last you and several dogs. This is the leash you buy when you don't want to worry about some tiny Chinese piece of plastic snapping off and letting your dog run in to traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Noname Norelation

customer_reviews.title: Replacing an old Flexi XL
customer_reviews.text: This product is very nice and a step up from the old Flexi I have had for about 5 years now (it was damaged through no fault of Flexi and had to be replaced). I really like the bright colored line and the handle is more comfortable to use. I've had it for over a month now and love it!
customer_reviews.author: LGray

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the performance of this leash. It's strong enough for my medium sized muscled dog that is a puller. The retraction mechanism is smooth. The leash gets twisted as it's reeling in at times, but that hasn't affected it's performance. Locks easily and is easy to hold once you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: magenta

customer_reviews.title: Bad!!! Lock so stiff!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this 3 months ago and the lock is so hard to push that it hurts! sometimes we cant get it to lock. i thought it was just new and stiff but its getting worse and now the return window has closed. The handle is also too skinny and hard to grasp tightly when a squirrel is present.
customer_reviews.author: Jarbells

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Made in Germany! Very high quality, will probably last a lifetime. This unit is quite large, I bought it for when I tandem my 2 Heelers. I'm going to try the medium-sized device. The medium says it is for a single 55 lb dog but I could air-lift my dogs with the Large device, it is so well made! ;)
customer_reviews.author: bobbo

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for a larger Dog that’s running after something for playtime
customer_reviews.text: This was nice in the beginning but here is my two cents. First my large goldendoodle pulled me and my wife off our feet . I think its simply physics ; the large 60 pound Puppy dog runs at full blast speed to retrieve his toy and when he gets to the end look out as all that force pulls you on your rear end, otherwise it’s probaly ok for walking i suppose but very heavy plastic handle piece
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Weathers

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Bright yellow tape! BEST leash hands down!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok yall, I've been through some leashes. I cant even count how many. I'm telling you now, this is the BEST leash out there!! Hands down!! It operates smoothly. No wesring/fraying of the tape. The tape is neon yellow! You can get it wet (the tape) and it doesn't hurt it at all. The button works great! My dog is 82lbs. This is perfect for him!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've had this leash for FOUR years now.
customer_reviews.text: This leash has been awesome for us. We have two young kids and a 60lb dog and it has stood the test of time...4 years now. Through drops on the floor and the concrete, sprints from the dog running after a squirrel, rain, snow, whatever...this thing keeps working flawlessly. I have no connection with the product. I just had to take a moment to give kudos to a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: debonair

customer_reviews.title: Nice and long
customer_reviews.text: Love the length and the HI-vis color. It’s been a few months and it still works, it lasted longer than thinner ones we’ve had. Not the manufactures fault but sand sometimes gets in the latch and jams it. My puppy also loved the rubberized texture of the handle and chewed it quite a bit when she got a hold of it one night!
customer_reviews.author: teacher mom

customer_reviews.title: Weak fabric does not stand up to my Lab, Mr. Pickles.
customer_reviews.text: I have a smaller sized version of this from Flexi from when Mr. Pickles was a puppy, and that stood up to his abuse for over 18 months. I got this version thinking it was better for an adolescent 85lb lab. On the first walk I noticed the webbing ripped, so I returned it for a replacement hoping it was defective. The second one is now also ripping. Mr. Pickles is sad.
customer_reviews.author: RobS

product_meta.title: Flexi Giant Tape Leash
product_meta.description: Style:Giant| Size:Large, 26 ft| Color:black / neonThis Black flexi Giant Retractable Dog Leash is for large dogs that weigh 110 pounds or less. This leash features a Grey soft grip handle, an exposed leash casing and a coordinating Grey retractable belt that extends up to 26 feet. This leash is designed for large breeds in typical walking environments and open areas with lots of space. The flexi Giant is available in 2 sizes and 5 popular colors. Over the past 40 years, flexi retractable leashes have become a must-have item for pet owners around the world. flexi retractable leashes are known for their high-quality, superior durability and attractive design. All flexi retractable leashes are handmade in Germany and are covered by a Limited Manufacture Warranty. Please note that this warranty does not cover dog chewing or misuse. All flexi retractable leashes come with a Safety Precautions & Directions pamphlet that describes how and when to use flexi retractable leashes properly. Inside every package is a safety collar and instructions on how to use it. The safety collar should always be used while walking your dog on any flexi retractable leash.
feature_bullets: Made in Germany & Covered by Limited Manufacturer Warranty
Retractable Belt Dog Leash Extends up to 26 Feet
Packaging Includes Safety Collar & Directions Pamphlet

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
